bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John R. Taylor, January 6, 1942

div1.p: Hench requests photos of Las Animas Hospital, Columbia Barracks, and other yellow fever experiment sites.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to John R. Taylor, January 6, 1942
div1.opener:
January 6, 1942
Mr. John R. Taylor
548 Grand Ave.
Upper Darby, Pa.
My dear Mr. Taylor:
div1.p:
I cannot tell you how much I appreciated your
interesting letter.

I am off to Washington this week but expect to
return in a few days and will write you thereafter. I have
a number of questions to write you and I am delighted at
your offer of help. In the meantime, can you tell me whether
you have any photographs of Las Animas Hospital and of your-
self and colleagues, also of Columbia Barracks, etc.?
Photographs of these places are extremely difficult to find and
I am anxious to obtain some to have copies made for a monograph
I am preparing on the conquest of yellow fever.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
